originalText.text: I started at 70th St, and moved to the Harlem location(the Women's Center). I wasn't crazy about Harlem, but I loved it after spending time getting to know the area(it's even better than 70th). Harlem is more laid-back and convenient. I was at the Bowery twice, and enjoyed my time there. Sure, there were up and downs because of the different personalities. However, I would always recommend any woman that needs a place to stay to get back on your feet again to go the Bowery. Thank you for your help.

originalText.text:
The real hero's of the Bowery Mission was the white guy who founded it and the donors who pay all the bills,and those who volunteer.The staff is demonic,they spend money on their own little parties while the clients eat rotting food.They abuse the mentally ill clients who don't know better to report the abuse.Those who donate should find another worthy non profit that actually makes a difference.Check out the Charity navigator it face book page they don't mention the success rate and how it helps clients, because it don't.Th

e staff steal most of the food and clothing donations.The living conditions at 315 E 115 Street are deplorable,I hhave video

originalText.text: If you are frustrated with life and if you are having trouble trying to get back in life and need a push as well as a place to crash this is a perfect place for you. Everyone goes through though time and there is nothing wrong about it as long as you are trying to be better and bowery mission harlem will help you with a bed to sleep and three meals a day 365 days a week. Their services doesn't end only here they have a full house of lawyers to doctors and mental health counsilors to help you get back to your life.

originalText.text: Best program in NYC to help you actually get back on your feet , and not just use you for your income or free labor. I can't say enough good things about this place.
